Event.0: President Roh Moo-hyun of South Korea walks across the Military Demarcation Line into North Korea on his way to the second Inter-Korean Summit with North Korean leader Kim Jong Il
Event.1: Pulitzer Prize-winning poet August Wilson—who was best known for a cycle of plays, each set in a different decade of the 20th century, about black American life—died in Seattle.
Event.2: British band Oasis release their second studio album "(What's the Story) Morning Glory?", sells record 347,000 copies 1st week
Event.3: American actor Rock Hudson died, becoming one of the first Hollywood celebrities known to succumb to AIDS-related complications; the extensive publicity surrounding his death drew attention to the disease.
Event.4: American lawyer and civil rights activist Thurgood Marshall was sworn in as an associate justice of the U.S. Supreme Court, becoming its first African American member.
Event.5: "The Bridge on the River Kwai", directed by David Lean and starring William Holden and Alec Guinness, is released (Academy Awards Best Picture 1958)
Event.6: Actress Joyce Randolph marries publisher Richard Charles
Event.8:
Annie Leibovitz
American photographer
was born
Event.9: New York Yankees catcher Yogi Berra hits the first pinch-hit home run in Baseball World Series history off Ralph Branca in the 7th inning of a 9-8 loss to the Brooklyn Dodgers in Game 3
Event.10: Polish resistance fighters capitulate in the Warsaw Uprising, with some 250,000 people killed
Event.11: Jazz musician Louis Armstrong (41) divorces Alpha Smith after 4 years of marriage
Event.12:
Johnnie L. Cochran, Jr.
American lawyer
was born
Event.13: Ethiopian Emperor Haile Selassie ordered mobilization upon learning that Italian forces had crossed the frontier to begin the Italo-Ethiopian War.
Event.14: "Prelature of the Holy Cross and the Work of God", known as Opus Dei, founded by Saint Josemaría Escrivá
Event.15: American Playwright Eugene O'Neill (20) marries 1st wife Kathleen Jenkins
Event.16: Belgium crown prince Albert von Saksen-Coburg weds Elisabeth of Bayern
Event.17: American poet Wallace Stevens, whose work explores the interaction of reality and what man can make of reality in his mind, was born in Reading, Pennsylvania.
Event.18:
Paul von Hindenburg
German president
was born
Event.19:
Charles Darwin's return to England
Naturalist Charles Darwin returned to England this day in 1836 after a five-year journey on the HMS Beagle, on which he gathered the specimens and observations that led to his theory of evolution by natural selection.
Event.20: George Washington transmits the proposed Constitutional amendments (The United States Bill of Rights) to the States for ratification
Event.21: British army officer John André was executed by the Americans as a spy after conducting secret meetings with American General Benedict Arnold during the American Revolution.
Event.22: King Henry VII of England invades France
Event.23:
Richard III
king of England
was born
Event.24: Sultan Saladin captures Jerusalem from Crusaders
